BRIEF-India Junior Finmin Says Open To Taking Carmakers Request For Tax Cuts To GST Council

Stock Markets 1 hour ago (Sep 06, 2019 16:50)

© Reuters. BRIEF-India Junior Finmin Says Open To Taking Carmakers Request For Tax Cuts To GST Council Sept 6 (Reuters) - India junior finance minister Anurag Thakur: * SAYS GOVERNMENT WORKING CLOSELY WITH THE AUTO INDUSTRY ON A SCRAPPAGE POLICY * SAYS AUTO INDUSTRY MUST SEE ELECTRIC VEHICLES AS AN OPPORTUNITY, NOT A THREAT * SAYS HAVE RECEIVED MULTIPLE REQUESTS FROM CARMAKERS, DEALERS FOR A GST RATE CUT TO 18% FROM 28% * SAYS OPEN TO TAKING THE REQUEST FROM CARMAKERS TO THE GST COUNCIL * SAYS AUTO COMPANIES SHOULD ALSO APPROACH STATE MINISTERS TO REQUEST CUT IN GST RATES Further company coverage: MAHM.NS
